card.description: This dataset is a list of exoplanets, which are planets orbiting other stars. With this data, it's possible to estimate the size of an exoplanet as well as other characteristics.

context.potentialUses: Estimate the size or mass of an exoplanet based on the size, age or other aspects of the star it orbits.
context.potentialMisuses: Trying to make guesses as to whether a planet could support life.

Star host name.description: The name of the start this exoplanet is orbiting.

Number of stars.description: Number of stars in the exoplanet's system.

Number of planets.description: Number of planets in the exoplanet's system.

Discovery year.description: The year this exoplanet was discovered.

Orbit length in earth days.description: How long it takes for this planet to make a complete orbit around its host star, measured in earth days.

Size in earths.description: The relative size of this exoplanet in comparison to earth.

Mass in earths.description: The relative mass of this exoplanet in comparison to earth.

Star temperature in kelvin.description: The temperature of the host star in kelvin.

Star size in suns.description: The relative size of the host star in comparison to the sun.

Star mass in suns.description: The relative mass of the host star in comparison to the sun.

Star age in billions of years.id: Star age in billions of years
Star age in billions of years.description: The age of the host star.
